properties.description: Red Door is a day centre for people who are homeless or at risk of homelessness in Bury. We provide a warm welcome to anyone over 18 and provide holistic support including helping with housing, finance/benefits and health issues, with a big focus on wellbeing. properties.address: All Souls - Bolton,, Bolton, England BL1 8EY
properties.description: All Souls is a beautiful historic church that has been converted for use as a conference, office, learning and community space. As part of this work, the original building was carefully restored. Renovation work began in September 2013 and was completed during November 2014. Established by the Greenhalgh brothers in 1881 for the wellbeing of the surrounding community, All Souls will now extend this welcome to a new generation, offering the latest facilities combined with the warm professionalism of our team. All Souls’ place at the heart of the Crompton community makes it the ideal base for local services, activities and events. Its unique beauty makes it a fine place to gain a greater understanding of the heritage of the church and its surroundings. All Souls is open Monday to Friday from 9am till 5pm. Occasionally for events we are open in the evenings and at weekends. All Souls - Bolton is managed by The Churches Conservation Trust, which is a national charity caring for over 350 historic churches in England.
properties.title: Richard Miller

properties.description: Weekly carers coffee morning. Refreshments are served free of charge. It is informal and friendly gathering for carers and their loved ones. We have singing, guest speakers and a supportive and safe space to meet.
properties.title: Bury Carers Hub (Bury Town Centre)

properties.address: The Met, Market Street, Bury, BL9 0BW
properties.description: Free workshop sessions that we’d be happy to be listed to encourage people to come and be warm and comfortable in The Met. One is our fortnightly ‘Meet Me at The Met’ session for over 50s. There’s an art activity and teas and coffees and it’s free of charge.
properties.title: The Met (Bury Town Centre)

properties.address: One Step Bury, Albert Works, Brook St, Bury, BL9 6AH
properties.description: We have a fire and lots of cosy, warm & thick blankets as well as cushions, all in our sensory room. We use these in our sessions and supportive group chats. Alongside this we are now offering soup, toast, brews & biscuits. We ask for a donation of £2 but this is not at all mandatory.
properties.title: One Step Vibe personal training Studio (Moorside)

properties.address: Bury Library Manchester Road, Bury, Lancashire, BL9 0DG
properties.description: We offer a warm welcoming space to everyone. We offer a service to all ages with free access to books, computers, Wi-Fi and online resources such as Ancestry. We also offer a range of electronic books and audio books and digital magazines that can be accessed free of charge. All of our Libraries have regular activity sessions for adults and children. For more information please contact your local library.
properties.title: Bury Library (Bury Town Centre)

properties.description: every Sunday in January and February 2024 from 11am - 3pm. A lovely warm space with access to family games and books, along with snacks, homemade soups, hot and cold drinks and more - open to all and totally free. For further information - friendsofclarencepark@gmail.com or pop by the Friends Hut near the bandstand on Saturday morning where we have a donations-only Tuck Shop on Saturday mornings from 8.30 - 10.30.
